湊.definition: to gather together, pool or collect; to happen by chance; to move close to; to exploit an opportunity

湊付.definition: to put together hastily; to make do with

湊份子.definition: to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)

湊合.definition: to bring together; to make do in a bad situation; to just get by; to improvise; passable; not too bad

湊巧.definition: fortuitously; luckily; as chance has it

湊成.definition: to put together; to make up (a set); to round up (a number to a convenient multiple); resulting in...

湊手.definition: at hand; within easy reach; convenient; handy

湊數.definition: to serve as a stopgap; to make up a shortfall in the number of people

湊熱鬧.definition: to join in the fun; to get in on the action; (fig.) to butt in; to create more trouble

湊趣.definition: to comply in order to please others; to accommodate sb else's taste; to make fun of

湊足.definition: to scrape together enough (people, money etc)

湊近.definition: to approach; to lean close to

湊錢.definition: to raise enough money to do sth; to pool money; to club together (to do sth)

湊齊.definition: to collect all the bits to make a whole
